revised_title: On the Construction of the Imperial Standard Pound and Quartz Weights
tldr: The author discusses the construction of the Imperial Standard Pound and its copies made of platinum, as well as the comparison of the Imperial Standard Pound with the Kilogramme des Archives. The author also explores the use of quartz as a material for weights due to its valuable qualities, such as its hardness, polishability, and indestructibility. The author mentions that quartz weights require extra care during comparison with metal weights due to the large amount of air displaced.
